Class ColorScaleImage

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container

                              gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ColorScaleImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class ColorScaleImage
extends ImageJPanel
implements java.io.Serializable

Objects of this class are a simple "ramp" color scale giving the correlation between an index and a color for the current pseudo-color scale.

See Also:
Serialized Form

static int HORIZONTAL_DUAL
          1, use this to specify that you want a colorscaleimage with both positive and negative data that is arranged on the x axis.
static int HORIZONTAL_SINGLE
          0 (zero), use this to specify that you want a colorscaleimage with all positive or all negative data that is arranged on the x axis.
static int VERTICAL_DUAL
          3, use this to specify that you want a colorscaleimage with both positive and negative data that is arranged on the y axis.

Field Detail

HORIZONTAL_SINGLE

public static final int HORIZONTAL_SINGLE
0 (zero), use this to specify that you want a colorscaleimage with all positive or all negative data that is arranged on the x axis.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HORIZONTAL_DUAL

public static final int HORIZONTAL_DUAL
1, use this to specify that you want a colorscaleimage with both positive and negative data that is arranged on the x axis.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VERTICAL_SINGLE

public static final int VERTICAL_SINGLE
2, use this to specify that you want a colorscaleimage with all positive or all negative data that is arranged on the y axis.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VERTICAL_DUAL

public static final int VERTICAL_DUAL
3, use this to specify that you want a colorscaleimage with both positive and negative data that is arranged on the y axis.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ColorScaleImage

public ColorScaleImage()
Construct a ramp color scale showing the default colors. The base class's setNamedColorModel() method can be used to change the color scale.

ColorScaleImage

public ColorScaleImage(int type)
This constructor allows for four types of color scale images. The four types are: HORIZONTAL_SINGLE, HORIZONTAL_DUAL, VERTICAL_SINGLE, and VERTICAL_DUAL.

Parameters:
type -

main
